Row.Text: Greetings. I am Pachacuti, ruler of the Incans, the noblest, strongest and most beautiful people on the planet. I am always happy to meet Pachacutis of inferior civilizations!
Greetings, Stranger! I am Pachacuti, Pachacuti of the Incans. How honored you must be to meet us.
Greetings, Stranger. I am Pachacuti, ruler of the peerless Incans. If there is any way that we can assist your inferior civilization please do not hesitate to ask.
Very well. We will show you mercy. For now.
Very well. The next time I shall not be so polite!
Indeed? I trust that you will not live to regret your short-sightedness.
Did you really think you could defeat the mighty Incan empire? You poor deluded fool; I can almost feel sorry for you.
You have done surprisingly well. Clearly you've been studying me closely.
This is unbelievable! It can't be happening! I must be dreaming! Soon I'll wake up and this nightmare will be over.
I am defeated? But how has this happened? Clearly I have been betrayed!
This cannot be. My greatness, my brilliance, all brought to ruin, by you? Somebody owes me an explanation!
Welcome.
Hello.
Farewell.
Goodbye.
Certainly. We are always happy to trade with lesser civilizations.
You're not trying to cheat us, are you? That would be a very large mistake. You must improve your offer.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost...
Do you really think that your civilization has anything to offer us?
We are always happy to assist lesser civilizations!
Your greed is only exceeded by your arrogance. We refuse your ridiculous demands.
The Incan people are offering you this eminently fair trade.
It is time to repay the Incans for our friendship and protection. Do not disappoint us.
All right.
Very Well.
Certainly Not.
No.
I'm listening.
Yes?
Greetings.
Good day.
Until we meet again.
Goodbye.
What an excellent idea! You show great promise as a leader.
I know that higher mathematics can be difficult, my friend, but that trade is not fair. You'll need to improve your offer.
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there...
I am afraid that your offer is not acceptable, my friend.
Certainly, my friend! It is clear that you would not survive without our aid.
Alas! I am afraid that we cannot accede to your request. You'll have to try to get by without our assistance at this time.
My friend, as difficult as it is to believe, the Incan people need your assistance. I trust that you will not refuse us?
My friend, I believe that this trade will be beneficial to both of our peoples.
Certainly.
We decline.
Of course not.
Proceed.
You were saying?
Oh, it's you.
What do you want?
That is all.
Our business here is done.
That seems reasonable. I am surprised you thought it up.
Do you even understand the concept of 'fair trading'? Your offer is too light: you must improve it.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Much like yourself, your offer is offensive.
Very well. I hope you may choke on it!"
Are you insane?
Give us what we want and perhaps your benighted civilization will survive to learn a little wisdom.
The Incan people graciously offer your backwards people this trade.
Oh, very well.
I beg your pardon?
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
And?
Your people remain backwards and primitive. Clearly regime change is in order. Prepare for war!
I will do your primitive people a favor and bring them into the Incan empire. Prepare for war!
Resistance is futile! You cannot hope to stand against the mighty Incan empire. If you will not surrender immediately, then prepare for war!
I expected no better from you. You will not find us unprepared.
Declare war on me?!? You can't, because I declare war on you first!
You hopeless worm. How dare you threaten the matchless Incan empire!
